title: Russia and Ukraine extend grain deal despite fierce fighting
description: The grain deal was welcomed Wednesday by the United Nations and the United States, though both called for more certainty over the exports as Russia has threatened to end the pact, which is crucial to global food security.

title: Montana becomes first state to ban TikTok
description: The measure, signed by the Republican governor on Wednesday, is expected to be challenged legally and will serve as a testing ground for the TikTok-free America that many national lawmakers have envisioned.

title: India, the new Eldorado of civil aviation
description: In the coming years, the South Asian giant will have to build airports at a frantic pace, buy aircraft, and train tens of thousands of pilots and technicians.

title: 1,100-year-old Hebrew Bible sells for $38M at auction in New York
description: The Codex Sassoon, a leather-bound, handwritten parchment volume containing a nearly complete Hebrew Bible, was purchased on Wednesday by former US Ambassador to Romania Alfred H. Moses and donated to ANU Museum of the Jewish People in Tel Aviv, where it will join the collection.

title: In Florida, DeSantis signs bills targeting drag shows and transgender kids
description: The Republican governor signed the bills in front of a cheering crowd on Wednesday in Tampa. The ceremony had a campaign-like feel, with DeSantis tossing Sharpies to a crowd, as opposed to when he privately signed measures on abortion and gun rights.

title: Japan faces risk of 'lone wolf' attacks on political figures
description: After the 2022 murder of Shinzo Abe and the attack on Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in April, the police are taking exceptional measures to ensure security during the G7, which is being held from May 19 to 21 in Hiroshima.

title: French LGBTQ+ community reflects on 10 years of same-sex marriage, and how the fight continues
description: A decade after the French same-sex marriage law was enacted on May 17, 2013, many gays and lesbians have painful memories of often 'outrageous' debates and a 'poisonous' social climate.

title: Cannes 2023: Director of controversial 'Le Retour' says accusations stem from misogyny
description: As their new film is presented in the official competition of the Cannes Film Festival on Wednesday, director Catherine Corsini and producer Elisabeth Perez respond to the attacks and rumors that they have been subjected to since it was filmed in 2022.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan say they were chased by paparazzi in New York
description: The couple's office described the chase as lasting more than two hours and said it was 'near catastrophic.'

title: EDF defends the resilience of its electric plants to rising temperatures
description: The main investments to adapt the French electricity giant's nuclear reactors should take place in the context of the visits to extend their lifespan beyond 50 years.

title: Three to face trial over assault of Brigitte Macron's relative
description: The great-nephew of French First Lady Brigitte Macron, who runs the family's chocolate shop, was beaten up in an apparent politically motivated assault on Monday evening.

title: Ten years later, many French mayors who opposed gay marriage have reconsidered
description: On the right, some elected officials have changed their minds, or now officiate at these marriages 'because it is the law.' Others still refuse to do so, entrusting the task to their deputies.

title: '72 Seasons,' Metallica's darker moments
description: Drummer Lars Ulrich, from the American heavy metal band, reflects on the genesis of their 11th album, ahead of two concerts at the Stade de France on May 17 and 19.

title: Cannes 2023: Apple and Amazon discover the appeal of movie theaters
description: Gone are the days when the tech giants shunned the Cannes Film Festival. Taking advantage of the uptick in global cinema attendance, they are now putting their films in cinemas first before releasing them on streaming services.

title: French government unveils plan to support struggling organic farming
description: Emergency aid has been increased to €60 million, with an overall package of €200 million. Representatives of the sector say this is insufficient, given the situation.

title: Ecuador's president, threatened with impeachment, dissolves National Assembly
description: Guillermo Lasso had been accused of embezzlement in the most recent challenge to his presidency.

title: Turkey elections: How Erdogan beat expectations
description: Although the incumbent was not elected in the first round on Sunday, he is ahead of his main opponent, Kemal Kiliçdaroglu. He performed far better most polling institutes had predicted.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Airports face 'great hospitality challenge'
description: As an official partner of the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games, the Paris airports want to 'give the best possible image of the country.'

title: Flash flooding kills at least five in northern Italy, Grand Prix canceled
description: Around half the annual rainfall fell withing 36 hours in Italy's northern Emilia Romagna region, causing fatalities, much devastation and the cancelation of Sunday's Formula One Grand Prix.

title: Russia freezes Finnish embassy bank accounts
description: Finland's foreign minister said Moscow has not yet explained the decision.

title: Complaint filed against French fashion groups over Uyghur forced labor
description: The allegations include crimes against humanity, aggravated reduction to servitude, genocide and human trafficking.

title: European Parliament elections set for June 6 to 9, 2024
description: The elections take place every five years across a four-day period and are considered the largest transnational vote in the world with more than 400 million eligible voters.

title: Cinema's return to the good old days
description: The Cannes Film Festival opened on Tuesday in an optimistic context: Worldwide cinema attendance is on the rise again and heavyweights like Amazon and Apple have finally stopped ignoring theaters.

title: Revealed: French authorities' failed maneuvers in lead-up to journalist's kidnapping in Mali
description: A joint investigation by news organizations including Le Monde reveals that the French military used journalist Olivier Dubois to try to locate a jihadist leader and failed to prevent his abduction. He was held as a hostage for almost two years.

title: ChatGPT creator passes US congressional hearing test
description: Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI, the company that owns the chatbot, called for regulation of artificial intelligence in a Senate hearing.

title: France's unemployment rate reaches lowest level since 1982
description: The number of job seekers stood at 2.2 million in the first quarter of 2023, according to the national statistics office. The unemployment rate is stable at 7.1%, but it increased among seniors in the first three months of the year.

title: Nicolas Sarkozy's three-year sentence upheld by appeals court in corruption case
description: The former president of France has appealed again to a higher court. His sentence includes two suspended years and could be served at home, with an electronic bracelet.

title: Former British PM urges UK to get tough with China on Taiwan
description: Liz Truss is on five-day trip to Taiwan. Bejing slammed the visit as a "dangerous political show."

title: Elon Musk at the Elysée Palace: A misguided embrace of a controversial figure
description: The French government's misplaced admiration for Elon Musk overlooks his troubling track record of spreading hate speech, disinformation and conspiracy theories.

title: China: 39 people missing after fishing boat capsizes
description: Over the past two decades, China has built the world's largest deep-water fishing fleet. But as stocks at home deplete, Chinese fishermen have sailed further afield and become entangled in a growing number of maritime disputes and accidents.

title: In Paris, hundreds of young migrants occupy an abandoned school in the 16th arrondissement
description: Mostly from West Africa, these young men have all attempted to pass themselves off as unaccompanied minors but have all been considered adults by the child welfare authorities.

title: In Ciudad Juarez, migrants are caught between Mexico and the United States
description: Title 42, a set of standards put in place during the pandemic, allowed for asylum seekers to be deported to Mexico without a review of their case. When it expired on May 11, it prompted an influx of migrants.

title: French government passes bill to accelerate the construction of new nuclear reactors
description: The law, officially adopted by the Assemblée Nationale on Tuesday, May 16, will allow preparatory work to begin at the Penly power plant site in Seine-Maritime as soon as 2024.

title: NBA: The San Antonio Spurs win the Victor Wembanyama sweepstakes
description: The Spurs were awarded the top pick in next month's NBA draft on Tuesday, leaving them in pole position to land French prodigy Victor Wembanyama.

title: The 'Irish Times' duped by a hoax article written by an artificial intelligence program
description: The Irish daily newspaper has since apologized for the op-ed they published on Thursday, May 11, written by a person who does not exist.
